document.topic_text: Trump assails Republican rivals' alliance as 'pathetic' By Doina Chiacu and Susan Heavey, Reuters WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Facing a potential wipeout in U.S. presidential nominating contests on Tuesday, Republicans Ted Cruz and John Kasich teamed up against Donald Trump, setting off a barrage of... Siemens says will continue to make digital acquisitions By Reuters, Reuters "Will we continue to invest in acquisitions? Definitely, yes," Klaus Helmrich told a news conference when asked whether Siemens would continue to buy so-called product lifecycle management software... U.S. CEO pay set to rise despite volatile 2015 markets: Equilar By Ross Kerber, Reuters BOSTON (Reuters) - Total compensation for the chief executives of large U.S. companies is set to rise for 2015 despite volatile markets and lower revenue at many, such as in the energy sector,... Valeant names Papa CEO after he resigns from Perrigo By Reuters and Greg Roumeliotis, Reuters Papa will replace CEO Michael Pearson, whose years of frenzied dealmaking fueled growth at Valeant until scrutiny of its controversial relationship with a specialty pharmacy and history of sharp drug... VW to go to U.S. court to keep 160 Tennessee plant workers from UAW By Bernie Woodall, Reuters DETROIT (Reuters) - Volkswagen AG said on Monday it would go to a U.S. federal appeals court in an effort to keep the United Auto Workers union from representing a portion of the company's plant... (Reuters) - Opponents of a North Carolina law that restricts bathroom choices for transgender people said they have nearly 180,000 signatures on petitions demanding its repeal as... U.S. appeals court restores Brady's 'Deflategate' suspension By Nate Raymond and Joseph Ax, Reuters NEW YORK (Reuters) - A U.S. appeals court on Monday restored the four-game "Deflategate" suspension of New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady, handing the National Football League a victory in... Obama, European leaders urge Syria parties to respect truce By Roberta Rampton, Reuters "They called on all parties to respect the cessation, ensure humanitarian access, and contribute to the success of the Geneva talks on political transition," the White House said after the meeting of... Google Glass-based startup raises $17 million in funding By Reuters, Reuters Augmedix's employees transcribe doctors' notes and update patients' electronic medical record through Google Glass. The San Francisco company, which has raised $40 million so far, also said it had... Wall St. dragged down by oil, lackluster earnings By Tanya Agrawal, Reuters (Reuters) - Wall Street was lower on Monday as a drop in oil prices, lackluster quarterly earnings and an impending Federal Reserve meeting weighed on investor sentiment. The central bank's... Oil down; Morgan Stanley, Barclays warn of bearish forces By Barani Krishnan, Reuters NEW YORK (Reuters) - Oil prices fell as much as 2 percent on Monday after an inventory spike at a key storage base for U.S. crude and leading banks in the commodities trade said a two-month long... Billionaire green donor launches U.S. millennial voter drive By Valerie Volcovici, Reuters WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Billionaire environmental activist Tom Steyer's super PAC launched a $25 million youth voter drive on Monday in seven political battleground states to help elect candidates... Cleveland to pay $6 million to settle police killing of Tamir Rice By Kim Palmer, Reuters CLEVELAND (Reuters) - Cleveland officials have agreed to pay $6 million to settle a lawsuit filed by the family of Tamir Rice, a 12-year-old black boy who was shot dead by a white police officer in... EU antitrust regulators to block Hutchison's O2 deal: sources By Reuters, Reuters The European Commission will this week seek the green light from national competition agencies for its decision, the people said. Such a move is usually a formality. Hutchison, controlled by Asia's...
